FuncDef:
The opcode end-m mirror-locator command configures a static SRv6 SID operation code (Opcode).
The undo opcode end-m mirror-locator command deletes a static SRv6 SID operation code.
By default, no static SRv6 SID operation code is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a static SRv6 SID operation code.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

IPv6 address mask.
The value is an integer ranging from 32 to 120.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Services that recurse to an SRv6 TE Policy must be strictly forwarded through the path defined using the segment lists in the SRv6 TE Policy. Considering that the egress of the SRv6 TE Policy is also fixed, if a single point of failure occurs on the egress, service forwarding may fail. To prevent this problem, configure egress protection for the SRv6 TE Policy.
In the SRv6 egress protection scenario, you need to execute this command to configure End.M SID on this node to protect another node's Locator.
Precautions
To ensure proper forwarding, configured static SIDs and IPv6 addresses configured on interfaces cannot conflict with each other.
